page.title: 05PLANNING PERTON
page.content: Twelve years ago in 1963 the idea arose of building a large community to house twelve thousand people. After a number of years the go-ahead was given. Perton Village was born and building began in 1968. At one time the planners forcast that the community was to have a Church, a number of Schools, a Health Centre, large Recreation Areas and Lakes. The first house to be completed in Wolverhampton's 'mini-town' was in fact a two hundred year old Farmhouse (now destroyed). This Farmhouse called Dippons Farm was in the south western sector of the development of some three thousand homes. Indeed the estate may not have been built built because of its great bill running into millions of pounds.
